subject: Technology
title: A/B Testing: How Platforms Experiment on You
description: A quick win: understand A/B Testing: How Platforms Experiment on You.

hook.text: Facebook once changed the News Feed for 700,000 users to see if it could alter their emotions. It could.

buildup.text: A/B testing shows different versions of a feature to random user groups to see which performs better.

discovery.text: Every button color, notification sound, and feed order you see has been tested against alternatives on millions of users.

twist.text: Facebook's emotion study showed sad content made users post sad things. Platforms can manipulate mood at massive scale.

climax.text: Users are perpetual test subjects. Every interaction generates data that refines the algorithm to be more engaging.

punchline.text: You're not just using social media. It's running experiments on you.

quiz.question: What did Facebook's emotion experiment demonstrate?
options: The platform could manipulate users' emotions through content selection
A/B testing doesn't work at scale
